TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs extends System.Windows.Input.KeyboardEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for and routed events, as well as related attached and Preview events.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event data class is used with the following attached events:
- <xref:System.Windows.Input.Keyboard.GotKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Windows.Input.Keyboard.LostKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=fullName>
This event data class is also used with the following routed events on base elements. These routed events forward the previously listed attached events to make them more accessible to the general element model in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)].
- <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.GotKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LostKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.PreviewGotKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.PreviewLostKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.GotKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.LostKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.PreviewGotKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=fullName>
- <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.PreviewLostKeyboardFocus?displayProperty=fullName>
The attached events and the base element routed events share their event data, and the bubbling and tunneling versions of the routed events also share event data. This can affect the handled characteristics of the event as it travels the event route. For details, see [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md).
If the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Keyboard.PreviewGotKeyboardFocus> event or the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Keyboard.PreviewLostKeyboardFocus> event is handled (<xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> is set to `true` in the event data), keyboard focus will not change.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Keyboard.PreviewGotKeyboardFocus> event or the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Keyboard.PreviewLostKeyboardFocus> event is handled, keyboard focus will not change.

MemberSignature.Value: public KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs (System.Windows.Input.KeyboardDevice keyboard, int timestamp, System.Windows.IInputElement oldFocus, System.Windows.IInputElement newFocus);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Input.KeyboardDevice keyboard, int32 timestamp, class System.Windows.IInputElement oldFocus, class System.Windows.IInputElement newFocus) cil managed

Docs.param: The logical keyboard device associated with this event.
The time when the input occurred.
The element that previously had focus.
The element that now has focus.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void InvokeEventHandler (Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void InvokeEventHandler(class System.Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget) cil managed

Docs.param: The generic handler to call in a type-specific way.
The target to call the handler on.
Docs.summary: Invokes event handlers in a type-specific way, which can increase event system efficiency.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation casts the generic handler as a <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventHandler> and then invokes it. For details on this implementation pattern and the reasons for it, see <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeEventHandler%2A> and [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the element that focus has moved to.
Gets the element that previously had focus.
